channel.title: A few useful things for 445:
channel.description:
If you're playing with the client, here's some help. Oh, and this is the non-deobfuscated version.
String wrapper class = kc String value = new String(kc.H) Player class = qc Player name = qc.pd Player array = gd.d Entity class = hd Entity health(current) = hd.lc Entity health(max) = hd.oc NPC class = kb NPC array = ba.Y NPC name = kb.Oc.vb NPC id = kb.Oc.Jb
Have fun!

item.title: A few useful things for 445:
item.dc:creator: @GenoDemoN GenoDemoN
item.description:
@GenoDemoN wrote:

[quote=“semaphore, post:14, topic:50880”][quote author=pplsuqbawlz link=topic=71288.msg810661#msg810661 date=1169569113]
Entity is a mislabeled class, the superclass of non playable and playable characters is without doubt “CHARACTER”… duh.

…blah blah blah…

player is actually player,
npc is actually monster,
[/quote]

Unless I have missed the time when The Company released a completely non obfuscated, non renamed version of their client, you have as little insight to the real names of the classes as anyone else.

As an aside, I happen to see nothing wrong with using the name Entity. Honestly, who cares if someone decides to use Terran, Protoss, and Zerg for the names of their classes? The only thing that really matters is that everyone understands the context.[/quote]
sounds like neXus is catching on

Read full topic

item.title: A few useful things for 445:
item.dc:creator: @semaphore semaphore
item.description:
@semaphore wrote:

[quote=“pplsuqbawlz, post:8, topic:50880”]Entity is a mislabeled class, the superclass of non playable and playable characters is without doubt “CHARACTER”… duh.

…blah blah blah…

player is actually player,
npc is actually monster,[/quote]

Unless I have missed the time when The Company released a completely non obfuscated, non renamed version of their client, you have as little insight to the real names of the classes as anyone else.

As an aside, I happen to see nothing wrong with using the name Entity. Honestly, who cares if someone decides to use Terran, Protoss, and Zerg for the names of their classes? The only thing that really matters is that everyone understands the context.

Read full topic

item.title: A few useful things for 445:
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

Lol, I’m not wrong, they’re all monsters… Just because you can interact with it peacefully doesn’t meant it’s not a monster… My ex girlfriend for example is a monster yet I don’t pull out a rune two hander and decapitate her face?

No not length of the array, length is an int which exists in the class. Sorry if I was unclear, but yeah… get it yet?

Read full topic

item.title: A few useful things for 445:
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

[quote=“pplsuqbawlz, post:8, topic:50880”]“Kb.Oc” Oc is the class is composite, and it originally was an innerclass of monster… You can thank ZKM for moving it outside.[/quote] I had figured as much, as that is the only lc ever used.

[quote=“pplsuqbawlz, post:8, topic:50880”]Entity is a mislabeled class, the superclass of non playable and playable characters is without doubt “CHARACTER”… duh.[/quote]However, they are still entities.

[quote=“pplsuqbawlz, post:8, topic:50880”]Another thing about stringwrapper… there’s an int field in the class you should hook. It’s called “length”, it’s necessary because just the bytes is dumb, why take the time to clear the memory location in the byte array when a simple reassignment from length can cause it to be of length 0. Better than resizing arrays all the time, which, is a badddd practice.[/quote]Why would I ever change the length of the array for my uses of it? The only use of it that I have is new String(kb.H).

[quote=“pplsuqbawlz, post:8, topic:50880”]player is actually player,
npc is actually monster,[/quote]Obviously, player is player But you’re wrong on the second part. Not all of the NPCs are monsters.

Read full topic

item.title: A few useful things for 445:
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

Entity is a mislabeled class, the superclass of non playable and playable characters is without doubt “CHARACTER”… duh.

Another thing about stringwrapper… there’s an int field in the class you should hook. It’s called “length”, it’s necessary because just the bytes is dumb, why take the time to clear the memory location in the byte array when a simple reassignment from length can cause it to be of length 0. Better than resizing arrays all the time, which, is a badddd practice.

player is actually player,
npc is actually monster,

“Kb.Oc” Oc is the class is composite, and it originally was an innerclass of monster… You can thank ZKM for moving it outside.

Read full topic

item.title: A few useful things for 445:
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

If you’re playing with the client, here’s some help. Oh, and this is the non-deobfuscated version.

String wrapper class = kc
String value = new String(kc.H)
Player class = qc
Player name = qc.pd
Player array = gd.d
Entity class = hd
Entity health(current) = hd.lc
Entity health(max) = hd.oc
NPC class = kb
NPC array = ba.Y
NPC name = kb.Oc.vb
NPC id = kb.Oc.Jb

Have fun!

Read full topic
